name: Marriott Orlando World Center Resort & Convention Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a nice experience the time we stayed,the front desk guy named Alex really help us with all our needs I gave us the best accommodation ever,this is the type of customer service that makes you say "I definitely comeback again",not without mention all the attentions from all the other personnel,I would definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: We stayed here May 13-17. We are two friends, traveling with a 3 year old and an 8 year old. We arrived at 11:30 pm. As the taxi driver helped us unload our 5 bags, stroller, and sleeping 3 year old, two employees stood at the front of the hotel and stared at us. My 8 year old retrived the luggage cart for us. As we struggled to make it inside the doors, one of the employees asked us if we had any questions!?!? Check in was 25 minutes. The only reason I can think is that it was because I paid with cash and she had to find change. A bellman did help us to our room. Room were fine, but somewhat small. The balcony was nice.
reviews.title: Disappointed.

reviews.text: The next morning, we inquired about the shuttle that takes you to Disney. I had stayed in Orlando before and we were able to catch it every hour. The concierge said that there is only one shuttle a day and you have to sign up for it. We had missed it. She said the hotel provides Towncars instead of taxis. I asked if the Towncars were the same price as a taxi, and she said it was exactly the same. That was absolutely not true. The ride (2 miles) to Disney was $35. The ride back to the hotel in a taxi was $17. When we asked the taxi driver why that was, he told us the hotel has a contract with the Towncar service, but if we request a taxi, they have to call one for us. Needless to say, we asked each day for a taxi.
reviews.title: Nice Conference Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shampoo, conditioner, and lotion were Bath and Bodyworks brand. Nice touch, but were never replenished.
reviews.title: Marvelous resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was very large and nice.
reviews.title: Wonderul stay. Can't wait to go back!

reviews.text: My husband and I were here on business, but it felt more like a vacation. We were here for a Funshine Travle Tradeshow. This place had everything. When I drove up I felt like I was in California. You drive up to and Palm Trees line the driveup and you can either request valet or park closeby. I suggest using the valet. I believe this is the largest Marriott Resort. This resort is truly a hidden Gem. It is actually located across the street from Nickelodeon Holiday Inn Suites. I'm not sure if I'd stay here or there. My kids would love both. This Resort is so huge they had North, South, West, and East towers. I was lost at first, but it was nice. I arrived early and they had a desk to keep your luggage in hand until check in and when our room was ready, they just sent it on up. My room had a balcony which overlooked the pool area, which was amazing. Our kids would go wild for all of this. They had jacuzzi's all over the property, a water slide which was nestled amongst palm trees and a cave like motif. We stayed here for a few days and we ate at one of the many restaurants, buffet style, pasta station was my favorite. The meeting rooms. registration and vendors were located downstairs. There is a grill by the pool and a wide range of food choices throughout the resort. In the wee hours of the morning I would sneak out with hubby and relax in the jacuzzi, it was perfect. I didn't want to leave, I'll definately go back next year. Before we left the Marriott was offering us an excellent deal to return so don't be surprised if your offered one of these deals, be prepared to purchase on the spot. They even have a specfic desk for this purpose. They also had Enterprise Rental Car on the property so you can rent a car onsite. I have never seen that before. Check in and out was a Breeze and Star Bucks onsite was a God Send in the mornings. I definately have to bring my kids with me next time. Nice!
reviews.title: All the comforts of home in one tropical place!

likes.liked: — The Property and all of it's resort like accomodations, Valet Parking
likes.disliked: — Having to wait to check in early

reviews.text: We reserved six nights at this hotel for a conference six months in advance. At check-in, they told us our room wouldn't be available until the next day. They gave us directions to stay at another Marriott seven miles away. We found this action to be unacceptable.
reviews.title: Ouch-bumped first night
Wow! It's Big
reviews.text: We did finally check in the next day. The room still was not ready until 4:00pm. The room was modest and amenities were average at best.
Restaurants were good, but very expensive. Pool facilities very good, but the two whirlpools that we used were out of order. Overall, our stay was below par and we would not repeat the visit.
reviews.title: My first room was horrible. The second was nice.

likes.disliked: — My first room on the fourth floor was dirty and dingy

reviews.title: a new years eve to remember
reviews.text: They tell me this is the biggest Marriott in the world and it's true. Built with the conference business in mind, this place is the size of a village and You will walk a lot. Several quality restaurants on site. Small food court and a couple of shops in the lower level. Starbucks on site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the arrival up to the hotel, to the departure when we had to leave. Everything was amazing! It was a nice getaway from work. The pools, bars, and restaurants were perfect. The customer service was top notch in all areas of the restaurants. Special thanks to the front desk for the upgraded room, and the valet manager who went above and beyond by cleaning my vehicle after our drive through all the love bugs from S Florida. Hats off to the entire front office staff. We will definitely be back again in the future.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just got back from Orlando and had a magical stay at the World Center Marriot! I was so surprised to see how expansive and well maintained the golf course and grounds were when we were first driven in by Jacques, a Marriot driver, basketball fan, and all-around cool guy. The room was spacious and clean. I would recommend a balcony room overlooking the pool. The view of the course, pool, and city is great and at night, you can see the fireworks over Epcot. The room service was very good and reasonably priced which is not typical at other hotels and the staff was all very friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Magical Stay at World Center Marriot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool has a fun slide and there are several hot tubs which is a plus when you are not traveling with kids. It’s also open later than other hotels so after long days at the parks, you still have time to go for a quick swim. Maybe I’m just attached because I got engaged there during my stay but I would definitely recommend this hotel as a place that has great restaurants right on property, friendly and professional staff, very clean accommodations, a beautiful pool, and is totally void of the cheesiness that you find in so many hotels in that area. World Center Marriot is a very impressive place to stay with all the amenities you could hope for.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY!!!!

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I had a great stay at this fantastic Hotel. The hotel is huge but we were greeted by every employee we passed with a friendly smile and a hello. The pool is amazing, it is huge, very clean and has a slide!! Didn't think that at my age I would be sliding anymore, but we did!!! We ate at the Steakhouse, Hawk's landing, the food was amazing, great ambiance and a great wine selection. Our server was was fantastic, we tried his recommendations and we were not let down. Great wines that I could afford and even better wines that I couldn't. The hotel was very convenient to all of the parks. It was just what we needed, a great romantic getaway, with amazing food, and a lot of fun! The golf course looked amazing from my room, we wish I would have brought our clubs.
reviews.title: Stung by this average hotel - be careful!

reviews.text: Stayed here for a business conference and it's a massive, sprawling hotel with a large pool, gym and plenty of conference rooms.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: Had to stay here for a convention - found out on arrival that the hotel is miles (literally) from everything. Not even shopping shuttles allowed on property. Other attendees worked out that you could take a bus to Universal, sneak awya and catch a shopping shuttle.
reviews.title: Way too expensive and locked in

reviews.text: Very expensive: $8 for self park (not clearly disclosed by desk), $4 for a 16 oz bottle of water in room, don't even ask about the minibar, $10/day for internet access, $1 for local phone calls + 55% surcharge on long distance calls.
reviews.title: Humongous Marriott is perfectly fine, though a bit generic

reviews.text: Unless you have a car and lots of money you don't mind throwing around, avoid this place.
reviews.title: Not as good as expected

reviews.text: SUMMARY: Over 2000 rooms make this the largest Marriott in the country and the "flagship" of the chain. The property is certainly well-maintained though--in my experience as a frequent traveler--it lacks the personal service, attention to detail, and unique character of similarly priced hotels elsewhere in the country. Ultimately I found it to be too generic, spartan, and impersonal to justify their typical rate ($200+). In this rate range I routinely receive far more luxurious treatment and room amenities (including full nightly turndown service, 400+ threadcount sheets, flowers, aromatherapy candles, in-room CD players, bathrobe, slippers, upscale toiletries, etc.). If you were to get a rate in the $150 range or less I would say it starts to become a good value. But, given what I paid and based on value for the dollar I can only give it a 3-star or "neutral/average" rating. This most certainly is not the best place I've ever stayed though many other reviewers feel this property hit that mark for them. I would simply say that I hope that they get the chance to stay somewhere truly remarkable in the future.
reviews.title: Fantastic - Simply Outstanding

reviews.text: PROS: fast and courteous check-in and check-out, received an "upgraded" tower room without asking, choice of optional bundled daily amenity packages (for example: parking, Internet access, bottled water, long distance, and more) valued at $40 for only $15 were a good bargain, rooms are very clean and in good shape, excellent air conditioning in my room (though others in my group complained that their A/C didn't work well at all), decent quality feather/down pillows and bedding, very thorough housekeeping, shower had good water pressure, plenty of hot water, great "sunflower" showerhead, wayfinding signage made navigating this enormous hotel very easy, glass elevators offered terrific views and were fun to ride, numerous elevators made for little to no wait, excellent pool area, gorgeous landscaping, very close to the various theme parks, excellent and reliable broadband (for a fee).
reviews.title: Best hotel in Orlando

reviews.text: I stayed at the Marriott Orlando World Center for a conference, January 18-24, 2008. I experienced excellent customer service during this trip. The front desk associate was wonderful, and cheerfully accomodated my request for a high floor level with a view of the Disney fireworks.
reviews.title: Great experience

likes.liked: — The views of Disney, and the high standards of customer service

reviews.text: The room was a good size, with a comfy King sized bed, and a roomy balcony. I had a great view of the fireworks each night. The hotel itself was very nice too. It had a gorgeous pool area, and plenty of chairs to sit and enjoy it. I ate at the Solaris restaurant a few times, and I would recommend the buffet there in order to get the most bang for your buck.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: The only downside to this hotel was the cost. Everything was super expensive, and I'm sure that being a primarily conference and business hotel that this is not a big problem. It was $19 per day to valet park, but this is the easiest way to park. The food was good, and well presented, but very expensive as well. This is not the hotel to bring the family for a vacation to Disney.
reviews.title: WORST HOTEL I've EVER Experienced

likes.disliked: — Everything except the pool. Worst experience that I've ever had.

reviews.text: Overall, I was quite pleased. I will add some photos in a few days.
reviews.title: Great Convention Spot

reviews.text: Went to Orlando for the weekend from Ft. Myers for my daughters 4th birthday. Plan was to go to Magic Kingdom saturday, which was great. All resorts on Disney property were booked, as we made last minute plans.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Marriott

reviews.text: I stayed at the World Center Marriott for several days for a business conference in May 2011 that was held onsite. The rooms were fine - comfortable and clean (exactly what you'd expect from a Marriott). However, the property was huge. A note for business travelers for onsite functions, request rooms in the East Tower - it's the tower/elevator bank closest to the convention facility and rooms - otherwise you're in a for a hike. The outdoor pool and resort facilities were beautiful and judging from the smiles on the revelers faces - alot of fun too. I never made it to the pool area, but I did have to leave the property for several events at area restaurants. A note about transportation options: they don't have a car service on premises, so if you don't have your own vehicle, you'll need a cab to get around as the resort is out of the way and nothing is within walking distance. Ask for a cab, not a car - a CAB. The resort has a relationship with Mears Transportation who are GREAT, but you will pay almost twice as much to go anywhere just because they're a town car service - but they use all kinds of vehicles (cars, vans, shuttles, etc), so it can be hard to distinguish. The valets will flag down a Mears car as they're usually lining the driveway, so you have to be sure to specify that you don't want Mears, you want a taxi. For reference, a Mears ride to the closest Red Lobster (less than 2 miles away) was $18. The return trip to the hotel (with an ATM stop included) was $11 - you do the math. I spent over $200 in transportation over the course of 4 days - in my opinion, that's unacceptable...
reviews.title: Resort hotel great for vacationers, not so much for business travelers

reviews.text: If you're looking to stay in Orlando at a nice hotel and remain on premises - it's a great option. Otherwise, prepare to rent a car because you'll be doing a lot of driving or find a hotel closer to the theme park/late night/restaurant action.
reviews.title: I thought the hotel was nice for our Zumba convention however....
Ehhh....
reviews.text: My room was clean and well appointed. I did hear of other convention goers who did not fare as well as I did though. They complained of water leaks and bugs. I saw no such problems thankfully. Also, the staff was very accommodating and friendly. I will have a good comparison next month when I attend this year's convention at the Peabody in Orlando. Convention goers last year lamented the fact that the Peabody was not available, so it should be interesting to see for myself. Stay tuned for that review in mid July!

I was here for a company meeting and for me, this hotel was just ok. The convention center is really nice, and some of the restaurants were very good, but the rooms were lacking. The rooms need to be renovated badly. The wallpaper in my bathroom was peeling off, the toilet leaked water onto the floor every time it was flushed and the furniture was outdated. I did love the fact that every room had a balcony....it was nice to get to see the fireworks show at Disney every night. We were a big group and I have to say that the staff was incredible. I also enjoyed the Starbucks in the lobby, but not the long lines in the morning. All in all, the hotel isn't horrible. I just expected the rooms to be nicer since it is a Marriott.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: One of the best hotel to stay in while in Orlando.. Very close to Disney & Seaworld and a very short drive to Universal.. Great staff great hotel... Love it
reviews.title: Swimming pools are a child's dream

reviews.text: Stayed here 4 nights for a meeting and trade show. I generally hate huge convention hotels so my expectations were set quite low. At least it is safe to say that this would never be my hotel of choice. But I found my room comfortable and all needs efficiently met. We hosted a reception and found food and beverage help to be excellent. Several good restaurants and bars too.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: I was there for a conference in October and it was near perfect! Shuttles to the airport and Disney made it inexpensive to get around. Although the facilities make it unnecessary to even leave the grounds. There are plenty of restaurant choices inside the hotel, the pool is huge and the golf course is great (for those who like golf).
reviews.title: Incredible business hotel

reviews.text: When there were AV problems, the hotel handed out $10 Marriott Vouchers to all conference attendees. That's what I call customer satisfaction and quality service.
reviews.title: Bland

reviews.text: Highly over rated bland hotel with absolutely no character.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.text: Pros: Clean, comfy beds, nice views, close to attractions, nice pool
reviews.title: We would return.

reviews.text: This is a sprawling property that caters to conference and business travel. While our conference was there, there were at least 4 other conferences either starting or finishing. It's a massive complex that was actually more efficient than other large conference properties where I've stayed. The rooms are updated--I was in a very nice double room on a very high floor facing the pool area. It was a very nice view. If you're going to a conference here, you should have a good experience.
reviews.title: Large, but Efficient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was one of the best we have ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Awesome View!

reviews.text: The staff was nice, the room was amazing and the view was breathtaking!
reviews.title: Impeccable Service, Beautiful Grounds!

reviews.text: We stayed on the 23rd floor overlooking the pool in the main hotel area.
reviews.title: Not Nearly What it Should Be

reviews.text: Our room had a huge walk closet and to our shock a jacuzzi bath!
reviews.title: Great location and lovely hotel

reviews.text: The good - the restaurants are excellent - the Japanese restaurent superb, the Steakhouse amazing and the best breakfast buffet I have ever had. Pricey ? No way for a major hotel - prices are equivalent to NYC restaurants. The restaurants alone are worth the stay.
reviews.title: The Good, The Bad, The Ugly

likes.disliked: — Lack of consideration for guests trying to sleep

reviews.text: Also the landscaping is supberb - the property looks great and the location seems to be central to a lot of attractions though if Disney or Univarsal are your prime destinations I can't see staying here. I was here because my wife's convention was at the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice for everyone

reviews.text: The bad - check-in - had to beg for a king bed though it was reserved - got a nice room (more later) in the East Tower which is the ony tower to stay in folks. The pool while really nice is just too cold and the drinks way too expensive.
reviews.title: Great conference area

reviews.text: The ugly - back to the room. The room wasn't bad and the A/C worked okay (not too hot outside) but the suite next door was being worked on so lots of noise but during the day I understand, what happened is that at 12:20am lots of banging - even the use of a jackhammer that awoke the whole floor - the front desk was no help at first and ultimately I had to go downtairs to raise hell in person. I was immediately given 2 vouchers for breakfast and that was great but the noise started up again at 12:45am and now everyone was ticked off and I stood over the balcony yelling at the front desk !!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Staff!
Second stay---wonderful hotel
reviews.text: Ultimately by 1:00am they got the workmen to stop and I was comped the night by a really good front desk girl. This was a very strange stuation - what could the hotel be thinking !!!???Working on rooms at that ungodly hour.

We stayed here on our honeymoon and I thought it was lovely. Ive read the reviews and I thought I was reading about a different hotel! I loved everything about the hotel. The receptionist staff were lovely and very helpful. The rooms were lovely, very clean everything we could have wanted. The pool was lovely and clean we never had a problem finding some where to sit. The only one down side was waiting the for the shuttle which was always late and one day even caught fire! I loved this hotel and would certainly go back
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: This was our 2nd time of staying at this wonderful, wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Blooming Marvelous

reviews.text: We was offered a room upgrade overlooking the main pool in the east tower for my 50th birthday at no extra cost. That is what is determined by a 5* class hotel.
reviews.title: This is a Marriott Resort?!! NOT!!!

reviews.text: The staff are excellent and very curtious. The guests are very normal down to earth people who do not have airs and graces just because they are staying in a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The best thing of staying here was the detailed driving instructions obtained from the main lobby of how to get to any theme park, any shopping mall etc etc. Plus return driving instructions back to the hote. Excellent!!!
reviews.title: Never again!!!

reviews.text: we stayed over xmas for seven days. very clean and comfortable and nothing was ever too much trouble.staff were very pleasant all except one member who served in gift shop (which we soon sorted out after having a chat with the manager)amazing views especially from the glass elevator which takes you 28 floors up!! perfect location for everything and excellent valet service for the car. although very pricey for everything we enjoyed the excellent cuisine in "hawks landing restaurant" and ate there a few times. room service was very quick and any shortage of toiletries etc were replenished immediately. we found there were quite a lot of bussiness people there and not many families on holiday. staff on reception were very obliging and on arrival we were given the choice of 2 rooms which we were given keys to go and view. we would definitely stay here again and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. there are plenty of places to eat near and around the hotel if you are looking for good value for money, although we felt that you don't always get quality if in large quantities. but at least the choice is there if you want it.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from our vacation at this Resort ( Nov 19-23) We were very pleased with this "huge" resort. I found it VERY easy to find our way around. Maybe it's a Texas thing but, it was not that big!!! The Staff was excellent and very helpful. Everything we requested was waiting for us. Someone greeted us at the entrance and walked us to check-in. It took only a few minutes. We stayed in the North Tower section with a view of Downtown Disney, Epcot, MGM and you could even see Space Mountain in the far distance. Our friends that met us there stayed in the East Tower. I think the North Tower was newly renovated. We liked it better!
reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.text: The pool area is very nice and has lots of seats. I noticed a lot of people said on here that they closed the pool if there was a chance of rain...well, we swam in the rain and used the hot tub during a rain storm. No promblem here! The inside pool was nice also. Our kids ( 12 and 9 ) also enjoyed the gameroom!
reviews.title: Very nice pool area! Very honest staff!!
Price-gouging hellhole...
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean but a bit small. The shower was very nice and the double sinks were very handy. The soap they leave you smells like "sweet tarts" ( big hit with the kids) The maids came everyday and gave us lots of extra towels. The beds are to die for!!!

I can say we never ate in the restaurants but, they looked beautiful. They posted their menus and prices right out in front so you would not be surprised when you got inside. The prices looked very fair to me. We were so close to International Drive and all the wonderful places to go there. It is just around the corner.
reviews.title: Much better than I thought after reading these reviews
Wow!
reviews.text: I was recently here for a conference and thought this was a great hotel!
The pros - wonderful room, clean property, fabulous pools and entertainment, great restaurants, fantastic spa and workout facility, beautiful conference rooms
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The cons - it is HUGE - you will be walking a ton. Rent a car because taxis in Orlando are highway robbery - i was glad I was expensing everything...Due to the conference, many of the restaurants were closed for private events during my four day stay so you'll have to go off-site to eat and there is no shuttle anywhere.
reviews.title: Excellent place for business/leisure combo trip

reviews.text: I would have loved to stay a few extra days, but not on my own dime as it is pricy. You could easily come here for a few days as a great way to relax and it's a fantastic trip for spouses/kids to come on the business trip with due to all the activities.
reviews.title: Huge hotel with great facilities

reviews.text: My husband and I, along with our two teenagers, stayed here for six nights from March 22nd-28th and had a great experience. We checked in the Saturday before Easter and check in was quick and efficient. We were in the North tower and had a view of the golf course and downtown Disney. I was hoping to have a pool view but was just happy to have a view at all. The woman checking us in was very polite, I don't remember her name but her tag said she was from Illinois. Every staff member we encountered was extremely friendly.
reviews.title: Nice resort, needs wireless

aka: Marriott Orlando World Center Hotel Orlando
description: Already one of the nation's most impressive hotels, Orlando World Center Marriott features the ultimate in comfort and style, just minutes from the city's hottest attractions, entertainment and dining options. And now, with refreshed suites, an all-new pool area, three water slides, a reconcepted on-site restaurant and more, our world gets better every day. Recently completed renovations include new Suites, surround yourself with the comfort of island-like tranquility whether resting up after your event or catching up on some work. Starbucks(R) has been redesigned and expanded to resemble those found on neighborhood street corners across the country and features additional seating for networking. The Falls Pool has offers a refreshing new pool experience featuring an expanded pool deck and function lawn for poolside events. Siro: Urban Italian Kitchen opened January 2013, a rustic-style venue aimed at showcasing fresh and authentic family-style Italian cuisine with local farm inspiration. Experience the new Falls Pool Bar & Grill offering refreshing beverages and casual dining, a renovated game room with interactive games and a Kid's Zero Entry Pool and water playground with fountains, bubblers, water mushrooms, in-ground spray jets, water cannons and lily pads. Finally, slide into summer with a new slide tower featuring two, 200-foot winding water slides and one, 90-foot speed water slide.
